entry.title: Lunar Surface Gravimeter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Lunar Surface Gravimeter (pictured) failed to turn the Moon into a gravitational wave antenna?

entry.title: McKinney Roughs Nature Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that McKinney Roughs Nature Park has an unusual convergence of four distinct ecosystems?

entry.title: New Zealand sixpence (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a hammer and sickle motif was proposed for the New Zealand sixpence?

entry.title: Voice of Freedom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Voice of Freedom had to counter poisonous snakes, leeches, and other wildlife?

entry.title: East Turkestan Revolutionary Party (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the seven leaders of the East Turkestan Revolutionary Party had Uyghur-language code names, the initials of which spelled out the word Lëninchi, meaning "Leninist"?

entry.title: Whitley Furniture Galleries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Whitley Furniture Galleries would increase the population of Zebulon more than eightfold when hosting an automobile giveaway in 1936?

entry.title: Gale–Shapley algorithm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Gale–Shapley algorithm was used to assign medical students to residencies long before its publication by Gale and Shapley?

entry.title: Skibidi Toilet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Skibidi Toilet inspired the Generation Alpha slang "skibidi"?
